meanings.definition: The practice or technique of deep-freezing the bodies of people who have died of a disease in the hope of restoring them to life in the future.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are studying cryonics to see if it can help bring back people in the future.
meanings.sent2: The concept of cryonics involves freezing bodies to potentially revive them later.
meanings.sent3: In the world of cryonics, frozen bodies await a chance to be awakened in the future.
meanings.sent4: The idea of cryonics is like pressing pause on life, hoping for a future play button.
meanings.sent5: Cryonics is like a frozen time capsule, preserving bodies for a possible resurrection.

meanings.definition: The freezing of a dead body to preserve it indefinitely.
meanings.sent1: Some people opt for cryonics to keep their bodies intact after death.
meanings.sent2: Cryonics is a method used to maintain a deceased body for a long time.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a frozen body in cryonics, waiting for a chilly eternity.
meanings.sent4: The concept of cryonics turns bodies into icy statues of the past.
meanings.sent5: In cryonics, bodies are frozen in time, awaiting a potential future awakening.
